--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "Bryce Fischer" <bryce@b...> wrote:
> > [I said:]
> > > I have implemented equals methods on my classes

> > [Dave responded with:]
> > Have a look at the Gargoyle extensions that Mike Bowler has written:
> > 
> > http://gsbase.sourceforge.net/
> > 
> > Part of it is EqualsTester

> That's excellent. Downloading now. Thanks

There's a few other thingd in there as well.  Mike wrote a section on
them for my "JUnit extensions" chapter.  And I made use of the
EqualsTester in the example.  It's very handy.
 
> I've just pre-ordered your book on BN. Looking forward to reading 
> it.

Thanks.  Just a note.. the BN site has the "real" cover, Amazon still
has an earlier version.

> I'm currently delving into several XP books (Java Tools for Extreme 
> Programming, as well as the Oreilly XP Cookbook)

To be honest, I haven't read those yet.  As you're looking at TDD, you
should read Kent's "TDD: by Example" as well.

> > I suggest EasyMock (www.easymock.org) as well as
> > MockObjects (http://www.mockobjects.com)
> 
> Thanks for the links. Got them bookmarked.

If anyone (else) on here is using Smalltalk, I have a dynamic
MockObject framework ready for use (similar to EasyMock).
 
> Got a lot to learn about TDDing.

We all do.

> Sucks trying to learn this while attempting develop software with a 
> deadline...

Yes, and the ironic thing is that once you get good at it, you'll find
yourself working faster.

> Thanks for the tips, 

Glad to be of assistance.

> and I'm sure this list will be hearing from me  again.

Good.. that's what it's here for IMHO.

Dave
